alert.note: Alert for La Paz; Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued June 25 at 8:01PM MST until June 25 at 8:45PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Southern La Paz County in west central Arizona... Southwestern Yuma County in southwestern Arizona... Southeastern Imperial County in southeastern California... * Until 845 PM MST/845 PM PDT/. * At 801 PM MST/801 PM PDT/, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near Martinez Lake to near Blaisdell to 11 miles south of Wellton, moving west at 30 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 1 and 29. CA Interstate 8 between mile markers 88 and 96. AZ Route 95 between mile markers 29 and 63. Locations impacted include... Yuma, Somerton, Gadsden, Martinez Lake, Fortuna Foothills, Blaisdell, Kinter, Andrade, Ligurta, Winterhaven and Araby. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
